alert.note: Alert for Pasco; Sumter (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 12:36AM EDT until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Withlacoochee River At Croom affecting Pasco and Sumter Counties. For the Withlacoochee...at Croom...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Withlacoochee River At Croom. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Farms and pastureland flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday night and continue rising to 9.9 feet on Monday. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.8 feet on 04/08/1987. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Withlacoochee River Croom 9.0 7.7 Wed 11 pm 8.2 9.0 9.3 9.7 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued as needed.
